titleStmt.title: SII 13.215: original edition by G.V. Srinivasa Rao
No. 215. (A.R. No. 367 of 1924.) MĒLAPPAḶUVŪR, UDAIYARPALAIYAM TALUK, TRICHINOPOLY DISTRICT. ON THE NORTH WALL OF THE AGASTYĒŚVARA SHRINE, AGASTYĒŚVARA TEMPLE.

summary.p: This states that on the representation of Karambiyaṉ Pirāntakaṉ alias Karuviḍaippēraraiyaṉ made to Aḍigaḷ Paḻavēṭṭaraiyar Maṟavaṉ Kaṇḍaṉār, the latter permitted the adoption of the maṉṟupāḍu at Paḻavūr by the servants of the two temples, the two (classes of) nagarattār and the 12 kalaṉai on the scale (or in the manner) that prevailed at Nandipuram since olden times. On receipt of the order by Vēḷāṉ Chintāmaṇi, the headman of Tattaṉūr, the first of the groups mentioned had it engraved on stone. The nagarattār's action on the same is recorded in No. 208 above. An inscription of Sundara-Chōḷa.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
svasti śrī . koirācakecarivanmarkku yāṇṭu 11Āvatu Aṭikaḷ paḻaveṭṭarai
yar maṟavaṉ kaṇṭanārkku karampiyaṉ pirāntakaṉāna karuviṭaippe(ra)rarai
yaṉ viṇṇappam Emperumāḷ paḻavūr Iraṇṭu taḷippatiyump pātamulamum Iraṇṭu nakaramu
m paṉniraṇṭu kalaṉaiyum maṟṟum Epperppaṭṭāraiyum(ṅ) kiḻppakalpaṭṭa
maṉṟupāṭum mel maṉṟuvaṉavum maṟṟum Epperppaṭṭanavum paṇṭai nan=tipurama
ṟṟātiye koṇṭu taruvatu Eṉṟu viṇṇappañ ceyya nāmum paṇṭai nan=tipura maṟṟātiye
koḷkaveṉṟu tattaṉūr kiḻavaṉ veḷāṉ ciṉtāmaṇikku śrīmukam vara cantrātittaval niṟ kka kalliṉ
mel veṭṭik
koṇṭom
Iraṇṭu taḷip
patiyum pātamu
lattom .
Digital edition of SII 13.215 by converted to DHARMA conventions by Emmanuel Francis.
